Sequence Information.Peptide Name: cBD103 (Canine beta-defensin 103, natural AMPs; dogs, mammals, animals, 3S=S; UCSS1a)

Literature.Author: Aono S, Dennis JC, He S, Wang W, Tao YX, Morrison EE. 2021
Literature.Title: Exploring Pleiotropic Functions of Canine beta-Defensin 103: Nasal Cavity Expression, Antimicrobial Activity, and Melanocortin Receptor Activity.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (84.78%) tohBD-3GRAVY: -0.65; Mol formula: C216H377N75O61S6; M. Wt:   5206.225, and Mol ex coeff.: 3355 (cys-paired). 3 disulfide bonds: Cys1–Cys5, Cys2–Cys4, Cys3–Cys6.Activity:  In rich medium, active against E-coli ATCC 25922, or resistant clinical strains (MIC>64 uM),  S-aureus ATCC 25923, MRSA (MIC>64 uM),  S. pseudintermedius clinical strain, no resistance (MIC 16 uM), S. pseudintermedius clinical strain, methicillin resistant MRSA (MIC 8 uM), P-aeruginosa ATCC 27853, P-hauseri ATCC 13315, E-faecalis clinical isolate (MIC >64 uM), E. faecium clinical isolate (MIC 8 uM). The peptide can kill nearly all the tested Gram+ and - bacterial strains in a minimal medium, indicating that medium components might have deactivated the peptide. Reg. 11/2021
